abstract: The Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim Helú has taken the top spot in the Forbes annual ranking of the richest billionaires in the world, pushing aside the two perennial leaders, Bill Gates and Warren E. Buffett, even though all three men added greatly to their wealth over the last year.
snippet: The Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim Helú has taken the top spot in the Forbes annual ranking of the richest billionaires in the world, pushing aside the two perennial leaders, Bill Gates and Warren E. Buffett, even though all three men added great...
lead_paragraph: The Mexican billionaire Carlos Slim Helú has taken the top spot in the Forbes annual rankings of the richest billionaires in the world, pushing aside the two perennial leaders, Bill Gates and Warren E. Buffett, even though all three men added greatly to their wealth over the last year.

headline.main: Slim Tops Gates and Buffett as World’s Richest Man

abstract: Live Sync, offered for free from Microsoft, allows you to sync your computers with each other, magically, over the Internet, with no effort on your part.
snippet: Live Sync, offered for free from Microsoft, allows you to sync your computers with each other, magically, over the Internet, with no effort on your part.
lead_paragraph: Last week, I wrote about an underpublicized gem in Microsoft's Windows Live suite of free online and offline services and programs: SkyDrive. It's a free, 25-gigabyte virtual hard drive on the Internet, accessible from any computer.

headline.kicker: From the Desk of David Pogue

abstract: Elliott Associates denied late Thursday that it was planning to sell any of Novell’s businesses if Novell accepts its unsolicited $2 billion bid, disputing a report that an asset sale was being considered.
snippet: Elliott Associates denied late Thursday that it was planning to sell any of Novell’s businesses if Novell accepts its unsolicited $2 billion bid, disputing a report that an asset sale was being considered.
lead_paragraph: 6:06 p.m. | Updated Elliott Associates denied late Thursday that it was planning to sell any of Novell‘s businesses if Novell accepts its unsolicited $2 billion bid, disputing a report by Bloomberg News.

headline.main: Elliott Denies It Plans to Sell Novell Units
